This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in {{BE}} 1.13.x releases, which assumes at least some familiarity with ''Bedrock Edition'' 1.12.x releases.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{| {{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}} 
|-
| [[Brown mooshroom]]
| [[File:Brown Mooshroom.png|128px|center]]
|
* Red mooshrooms will turn into brown mooshrooms when struck by [[lightning]].
* Breeding two red [[mooshroom]]s has <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>1024</sub> chance to spawn a brown baby variant, and vice versa.
|
{{Drop|Item|Leather|0|2}}
{{Drop|Item|Raw Beef|1|3}}
{{Drop|Item|Steak|1|3}} (If killed by fire)
| Brown mooshrooms will give the player [[suspicious stew]] when fed a flower and milked with a bowl.
|-
| [[Fox]]
| {{animate|Fox.png;Snow Fox.png;Sitting Fox.png;Sitting Snow Fox.png;Sleeping Fox.png;Sleeping Snow Fox.png|128px|center}}{{animate|Baby Fox.png;Baby Snow Fox.png;Sitting Baby Fox.png;Sitting Baby Snow Fox.png;Sleeping Baby Fox.png;Sleeping Baby Snow Fox.png|84px|center}}
|
* Foxes can spawn in [[taiga]] and [[snowy taiga]] biomes.
* Foxes can also spawn in taiga villages in groups of 1–3.
| {{xp|1|2}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
* Wolves and polar bears are aggressive towards foxes.
* Baby foxes born by breeding two adult foxes will be loyal towards the player.
* Trusting foxes can attack the player if their trusted player is damaged.
* Foxes will eat any food-item, and can pick up any item in their mouth.
* Foxes sleep during the day and are active at night.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}} 
|-
| [[Camera]]
| [[File:Camera.png|128px]]
| 
* Can no longer be obtained with the {{cmd|/give}} commands.
* Added functionality. Screenshots took by the camera can now be saved into the screenshots folder.
|-
| [[Fish]]
| {{animate|Cod.png;Salmon.png;Clownfish.png|128px}}
| Now drop experience when killed.
|-
| [[Illager captain]]
| {{animate|Pillager with Ominous Banner.png;Vindicator with Ominous Banner.png|128px}}
| The player now correctly receives the [[Bad Omen]] effect whenever the illager captain dies in combat with the player.
|-
| [[Player]]s
| {{animate|Steve JE3 BE1.png;Alex.png|128px}}
|
* Are now 1.8 blocks tall.
* Default Steve, Alex and character creator skins can now blink.
|-
| [[Squid]]
| [[File:Squid.gif|128px]]
| Can now spawn in rivers.
|-
| [[Villager]]
| {{animate|Plains Villager Base.png;Desert Villager Base.png;Jungle Villager Base.png;Savanna Villager Base.png;Snowy Villager Base.png;Swamp Villager Base.png;Taiga Villager Base.png|128px}}
|
* Can now heal if they have bread in their inventory.
* Master-level farmers can now sell suspicious stew.
* Cartographer trades now require 11 glass panes instead of 10.
* Villager trade levels now match Java Edition with 5 profession level badges, rather than 3 level badges.
|}

== Blocks ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Blocks}}
|-
| [[Dead coral]]
| {{animate|Dead_Tube_Coral.png;Dead_Brain_Coral.png;Dead_Bubble_Coral.png;Dead_Fire_Coral.png;Dead_Horn_Coral.png|84px}}<br>
| Can be obtained by placing their living variety in any area not directly adjacent to water.
| Can be broken with any tool as well as by hand.
| Can be used as decorative blocks.
|-
| [[Light block]]
| {{animate|Light 0 BE1.png;Light 1 BE1.png;Light 2 BE1.png;Light 3 BE1.png;Light 4 BE1.png;Light 5 BE1.png;Light 6 BE1.png;Light 7 BE1.png;Light 8 BE1.png;Light 9 BE1.png;Light 10 BE1.png;Light 11 BE1.png;Light 12 BE1.png;Light 13 BE1.png;Light 14 BE1.png;Light 15 BE1.png|84px}}<br>
| Can be obtained only with commands.
| N/A
| To give this block. {{cmd|/give @p light_block}} 0-15
|-
| [[Structure void]]
| [[File:Structure Void BE1.png|84px]]
| {{cmd|/give @p structure_void}}
| N/A 
|
*  An intangible block used to indicate to the structure blocks that certain air blocks can be overridden by previously existing blocks in the destination.
* Invisible and have a small hitbox.
** Visible only when they are inside a structure being saved by a save structure blocks and the toggle option "show invisible blocks" is true.
* Allows for empty spaces in a structure.
|-
| [[Wither rose]]
| [[File:Wither Rose.png|84px]]
| A wither rose will drop from mobs killed by a [[wither]].
| Wither Roses can be broken with any tool as well as by hand.
|
* Wither Roses can be used to craft [[suspicious stew]] with the [[Wither (status effect)|Wither]] effect.
* Any mob standing on a Wither rose will be inflicted with one second of the Wither effect for as long as they continue to touch it.
|}

| [[Coral]]
| {{animate|Tube Coral.png;Brain Coral.png;Bubble Coral.png;Fire Coral.png;Horn Coral.png|84px}}

== Items ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Items}} 
|-
| [[Suspicious stew]]
| [[File:Suspicious Stew JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|A2=Brown Mushroom|B2=Red Mushroom|A3=Bowl|B3=Any Small Flower|Output=Suspicious Stew|shapeless=true}}
|
* Suspicious stew gives a status effect to the player after eating it, the effect given depends on the flower used to craft it.
* The effect is hidden after suspicious stew is crafted, making it impossible to tell ones with negative effect from ones with positive effects.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Items}}
|-
| [[Armor]]
|
| Worn armor no longer turns red when a player or [[mob]] takes [[damage]].
|-
| [[Turtle egg]]
| [[File:Turtle Egg (item) JE2 BE2.png|84px]]
| Now have 2D textures in the [[inventory]].
|-
| [[Map]]
| [[File:Locked Map (item).png|84px]]
| Locked maps now have a unique inventory icon.
|}
